revised_title: Effects of Different Positive Metals on the Changes of Potential of Voltaic Couples
tldr: The author investigates the effects of different positive metals on the changes of potential in voltaic couples using various galvanometers and electrolytes. The results show that the minimum proportion of acid required to change the potential varies depending on the type of metal and galvanometer used, and the order of change in electromotive force by varying the strength of the liquid is similar for different metals.
